content.description: This is an interesting toprope or an unprotected headpoint.  The route has some thoughtful climbing and mostly clean rock.
content.protection: There is very little protection available on this route, and none whatsoever until after the crux.  There is a single bolt with a homemade hanger at the top of the route, and there is a tree available to back it up.  Some long slings or static line would be useful.
content.location: Just right of the arete on the left side of the crag and just right of Belladonna, a short finger crack in a dihedral.  Descend by walking off to the south.

content.description: This funny little climb starts in a small, right-facing dihedral then moves up in a bowl-like feature. Some tricky smearing gets you to a horn (which Rossiter points out, was lassoed on the FA). Now move up to a horizontal break and summit.
content.protection: A lasso, some stoppers, and a few mid-sized cams. You can get TR access from the back. There is a bolt plus some cracks for gear.

content.description: This starts off as a hanging slab. Follow the right-angling cracks and corners up the overhanging face.
content.location: This is the rightmost bolted route at the crag.

climbs.name: Cool Operator
climbs.fa: Mark Rolofson, Henry Lester, John Payne, 1985

content.description: Start in a thin crack then pull up and right onto the face to more difficult and tenuous face climbing on thin holds and shallow seams.  Work up to a good rest, then stem and crimp to the finish.  The climbing is insecure and protection is next to nothing.  Leading this would be a bold headpoint.
content.protection: There is very little protection on this route.  It may be possible to wiggle in some RPs or small cams in places, but falling would be a bad idea.  There are two bolts with homemade hangers at the top.  Some long slings or static rope would be handy to back these up for a toprope anchor.
content.location: The route is in the center of the west side of Little Crag and starts in a thin crack on the right side of a rib.  Descend by rapping from the bolts or walking off to the south.

content.protection: Five bolts to an aged two bolt anchor.  Stick Clip.
content.location:
This is just right of

Smooth Operator

.

content.description: This is a short but fun finger crack that has some cool fingerlocks and stemming.  It can also be safely led, just avoid placing gear behind the short section of fragile flake.
content.protection: A single set of cams to a #2 Camalot.  There is a single hangerless 1/2" bolt at the top of the pitch.  Some long slings or static line would be handy to set a toprope.
content.location: This is the leftmost route on Little Crag.  The route starts in a dihedral right in front of a pine tree.  The easiest way down is to walk off to the south.
